channel.title: Current team members on Cooperstone Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Current team members on Cooperstone Lab

item.title: Jordan (JL) Hartman
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2019-present Research focus: Understanding the chemical basis of bitterness from high alkaloid tomatoes. Pubs: Dzakovich MP, Hartman JL, Cooperstone JL. A high-throughput extraction and analysis method for steroidal glycoalkaloids in tomato. Front Plant Sci, 2020;11:767. https://doi.org/10.3389/fpls.2020.00767 Also published a preprint on bioRxiv. Background: B.S. Biology, Wingate University, M.S. Horticultural Science, North Carolina State University Hometown: Salisbury, NC Contact: hartman dot 635 at osu dot edu

item.title: Maria Sholola
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science & Technology Years in the lab: 2020-present Research focus: Understanding absorption, metabolism, and bioactivity of tomato and soy phytochemicals. Background: B.S. Chemistry, Loyola University, Chicago, IL Hometown: Chicago, IL Contact: sholola dot one at osu dot edu

item.title: Daniel Quiroz Moreno
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2021-present Research focus: Multi-omic integration for crop nutritional improvement Background: B.S. Biotechnology, Ikiam University, Tena, Ecuador Hometown: Riobamba, Ecuador Contact: quirozmoreno dot 1 at osu dot edu

item.title: Daniel Do
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science and Technology Years in the lab: 2021-present Research focus: Background: B.S. Chemistry, Stockton University, Galloway, NJ Hometown: Galloway, NJ Contact: do dot 226 at osu dot edu

item.title: Lydia Balogh
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2022-present Research focus: Background: B.S. Biology, minor in English Language and Literature, University of Western Ontario, Canada Hometown: London, Ontario, Canada Contact: balogh dot 67 at osu dot edu

item.title: Aaron Wiedemer
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science & Technology Years in the lab: 2022-present Research focus: Background: B.S. Food Science, minor Jazz Performance, Penn State University, University Park, PA Hometown: Contact: wiedemer dot 7 at osu dot edu

item.title: Avery Brewer
item.description: Degree: B.S. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science, Sustainable Plant Systems, Plant Biosciences Years in the lab: 2020-present Research focus: Understanding tomato steroidal alkaloid response to mechanical wounding in tomato Hometown: Hudson, OH Contact: brewer dot 504 at osu dot edu

item.title: Emma Bilbrey
item.description: Degree: M.S.. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab (as a student): 2018-2020 Years in the lab (as staff): part-time in the flower farming off-season Dissertation title: Seeding multi-omic improvement of apple What has Emma been doing since she left the lab: After she completed her M.S., Emma started her very own flower farm, Hickory Hills Flower Farm in Valparaiso, IN. She also works part-time for the Cooperstone lab as a data scientist.

item.title: Nacho (Cooperstone)
item.description: Degree: Working on basic obedience Years in the lab: 2018-present Areas of focus: Snoring during Zooms, rolling around in the dirt after a bath, eating cheese. Hometown: Columbus, OH
